description:
11.98 find_rect
Find a rectangular object in the input video.

The object to search for must be specified as a gray8 image specified with the
object option.

For each possible match, a score is computed. If the score reaches the specified
threshold, the object is considered found.

If the input video contains multiple instances of the object, the filter will
find only one of them.

When an object is found, the following metadata entries are set in the matching
frame:

It accepts the following options:
name: find_rect

options.description: Filepath of the object image, needs to be in gray8.
options.name: object

options.description:
Detection threshold, expressed as a decimal number in the range 0-1.

A threshold value of 0.01 means only exact matches, a threshold of 0.99 means almost everything matches.

Default value is 0.5.
options.name: threshold

options.description: Specifies the rectangle in which to search.
options.name: xmin

options.description: Specifies the rectangle in which to search.
options.name: ymin

options.description: Specifies the rectangle in which to search.
options.name: xmax

options.description: Specifies the rectangle in which to search.
options.name: ymax

options.description: Discard frames where object is not detected. Default is disabled.
options.name: discard
